Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery chalice(?) foot. Broad black band on underside; edge of rim reserved; top glazed with added white and red bands at edge. Incised inscription on top.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Area of Site 4 (Hogarth) and just south of Site 3 (Hogarth) ('on the mud just outside its [Site 3] north-west and south walls': Hogarth et al. 1898-9, 31-2)
Curator's comments: Hogarth explains how this sherd was excavated in the region just outside of the north-west and south walls of Chamber 3 in the Hellenion. See Hogarth (1898/1899), p. 32.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 55, no. 54)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 700, no. 577)
Höckmann & Möller 2006 / The Hellenion at Naukratis: Questions and Observations (p. 15, fig. 8 fig. 9, no. 57 no. 81)
Hogarth 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, A. Site and Buildings (p. 32, no. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1001)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
